text.p: For all [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline], let [mathjaxinline]S(v)[/mathjaxinline] be the vector obtained by reflecting [mathjaxinline]v[/mathjaxinline] across the diagonal line [mathjaxinline]x=y[/mathjaxinline] and then rotating the result by [mathjaxinline]90^\circ[/mathjaxinline] counterclockwise. [mathjaxinline]S[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation from [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] to [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline]. What is its standard matrix?
